item.title: [FLINK-10364] Test instability in NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendITCase#testMapState
item.description:
Tests run: 12, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 14.365 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendITCase
testMapState(org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendITCase)  Time elapsed: 0.253 sec  <<< ERROR!

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Happened to me as well on master branch:
https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/430119824/log.txt
Another instance on master: https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/431500062/log.txt
kkl0u any idea what could cause this?

StefanRRichter opened a new pull request #6975: FLINK-10364[tests] Fix instability in NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendI…
URL: https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/6975

…TCase#testMapState

    1. What is the purpose of the change

This PR fixes a potential NPE in `AbstractQueryableStateTestBase#testMapState` by extending the condition to retry the query under test.

StefanRRichter commented on issue #6975: FLINK-10364[tests] Fix instability in NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendI…
URL: https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/6975#issuecomment-435855839

Thanks for the review @kl0u. I think the NPE can be caused by some consistency/visibility problem that I think can happen in queryable state, so giving it a retry will probably yield a successful result eventually. Merging.

----------------------------------------------------------------

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.

the sake of provenance:

below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

false,
executor);
